{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3525303,"name":"Ryan","username":"devmonkeyy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/3ec8ea/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T20:42:11.332Z","cooked":"

Hi all,
We’ve been having some issues with our VividHosting VH-109 FRC Radio. The Sys light has not moved beyond 1hz, no matter which firmware we try to flash onto it, even though the WPA configuration seems to be succeeding. we are also using a StarTech ethernet to usb adapter and are powering the radio via the REV Radio Power Module. Nothing from VividHosting seems to be working to get the radio firmware uploaded, and we either get an TypeError error message, or the website simply stops loading and the sys light doesn’t change.

Screenshot 2025-02-12 1536071889×753 40.1 KB

Can you please replace the /configuration with /status in the URL you opened?
And please share a screenshot of the text you see

Looks like you might be using the wrong firmware file,
(There are different files depending on what version you are upgrading from)
Have you attempted to use the other file?
